For example, an impairment charge recognised in the current reporting period in accordance with
IAS 36 Impairment of assets is a current financial effect whereas a disclosure in accordance with
IAS 36 paragraph 134 (f), requiring the disclosure of a potential impairment based on a
‘reasonable possible change in key assumptions’, is an anticipated financial effect.
